result.title: Week 1 — New Year's Resolution
result.content:
2017 is now behind us! It has been a crazy year: SAT/ACT, College Essays, MIT PRIMES, Mathcamp, becoming a club president, and many more. Fortunately, as we start 2018 I don't have any more obligations — time to get my skills up (git gud)!

I ended Good Bye 2017 with a rating of 1734 (Expert). The goal this year? Get to IM (2300+). That is a 566 point difference. It's certainly be difficult to achieve, but I have my hopes up!

But first of all, I am in a duel with mgintz on Codeforces ratings. He is insanely talented in math and CS, so he will be the worthiest of adversaries for me.

Week 1: 1/1-1/7 Bring C++ into shape. Benq and most writers of USACO use C++, so I should try to at least understand it.

Follow the book Accelerated C++ in the following pace:

12/30: Review Goodbye 2017

12/31: Chapters 3-6

1/1: Chapters 7-10

1/2: Chapters 11-12

1/3: Chapters 13-14

1/4: Chapters 15-16

1/5: Virtual participate in Codeforces Round #456 + Review

1/6: Lingering questions in the book + Pointers pt 1

1/7: Pointers pt 2

Voluntary punishment: when something is incomplete, no League Of Legends the next day.
